title: Polygon: Scaling Ethereum With MATIC - Markets.com
content:
The Polygon blockchain technology, coupled with the MATIC token ecosystem, provides a robust infrastructure for Ethereum scaling.

By leveraging the power of Polygon, developers and users can enjoy faster transactions, lower costs, and an overall seamless experience within the Ethereum ecosystem.

But what exactly are the benefits of using Polygon for scaling Ethereum? Well, for starters, Polygon's scalability solutions are designed to enhance transaction speed, reduce gas fees, and increase the efficiency of the Ethereum network. It's a win-win situation for both developers and users alike.

Integrating the MATIC network for Ethereum scaling is a straightforward process that brings exponential benefits. By following a few simple steps, developers can seamlessly integrate their dApps with the MATIC network, unlocking the full potential of Ethereum scalability.

As we look ahead, the future of scaling Ethereum with MATIC looks bright. Ongoing research and advancements in the field are paving the way for even more innovative solutions.

The integration of Polygon and the MATIC network is set to transform the Ethereum landscape, opening up new possibilities for decentralised finance and beyond.

Polygon and the MATIC network offer a game-changing solution for scaling Ethereum. By harnessing the power of Polygon's blockchain technology and the MATIC token ecosystem, developers and users can enjoy a faster, more efficient Ethereum experience.

So brace yourself for the future, where the scalability of Ethereum meets the capabilities of Polygon and MATIC network integration.

Must Read: Crypto Trading: The ultimate beginner’s guide Content

Understanding Ethereum Scaling Challenges

Scaling Ethereum has become an urgent concern due to the challenges it faces in terms of scalability and rising gas fees. The need for Layer 2 scaling and reducing gas fees has become a critical focus for the Ethereum community.

The Challenge of Scalability

Ethereum, the world's leading smart contract platform, is experiencing scalability issues as its popularity and usage continue to grow. The network's current capacity is limited, resulting in slower transaction speeds and increased congestion.

High Gas Fees

One of the main challenges faced by Ethereum users is the soaring gas fees. These fees, paid by users to miners for processing transactions, have surged to unprecedented levels during peak demand periods. This has made it less feasible for smaller transactions and has hindered user adoption.

Layer 2 Scaling Solution

To address these challenges, Layer 2 scaling solutions are being developed for Ethereum. Layer 2 scaling refers to off-chain solutions that aim to increase the network's capacity and reduce congestion.

These solutions enable faster and cheaper transactions while maintaining the security and decentralisation of the Ethereum network.

Reducing Gas Fees

Reducing gas fees is another crucial aspect of Ethereum scaling. By optimising transaction processing and implementing more efficient fee structures, the aim is to make Ethereum more accessible to users and encourage broader adoption. This will allow Ethereum to be used for smaller transactions without the burden of high fees.

Layer 2 scaling for Ethereum

Ethereum gas fee reduction

By addressing the scalability challenges and reducing gas fees, Ethereum can become a more efficient and cost-effective platform, attracting a wider range of applications and users.

Introducing Polygon Blockchain Technology

Polygon, formerly known as Matic Network, is a protocol and framework for building and connecting Ethereum-compatible blockchain networks. It aims to address the scalability issues faced by Ethereum and enable faster more efficient transactions.

By leveraging Polygon's Layer 2 scaling solutions, developers can create scalable dApps and smart contracts that retain all the security benefits of the Ethereum mainnet. Polygon achieves this through its unique architecture, which combines Ethereum's security with the flexibility of a standalone blockchain.

One of the key features of Polygon is its ability to support multiple sidechains, also known as "Polygon chains." These chains are designed to be highly scalable and interoperable, allowing developers to build and deploy their own customised blockchain networks.

The MATIC Token Ecosystem

Within the Polygon ecosystem, the MATIC token plays a vital role. MATIC is the native cryptocurrency of the Polygon network and serves as a utility token for various functions within the ecosystem.

Firstly, the MATIC token is used for securing the network through staking. Validators stake MATIC tokens to validate transactions and secure the network against potential attacks. In return, they earn rewards for their contributions.

MATIC also acts as a gas fee token, allowing users to pay for transaction fees on the Polygon network. This helps to reduce the overall cost of transactions and make decentralised applications more accessible to users.

Furthermore, MATIC is used for governance and decision-making within the Polygon network. Token holders can participate in the voting process to influence the protocol's direction and development.

Polygon's blockchain technology offers a scalable and efficient solution for scaling Ethereum. With its Layer 2 scaling solutions and the MATIC token ecosystem, Polygon provides developers and users with the tools and resources needed to build and interact with decentralised applications on a larger scale.

Benefits of Polygon Scaling for Ethereum

One of the key benefits of using Polygon for scaling Ethereum is the significant improvement in transaction speed. The MATIC network, integrated with Ethereum, enables faster and more efficient processing of transactions.

With Polygon, you can experience quicker confirmation times and reduced waiting periods, enhancing the overall user experience.

Benefits of Polygon Scaling:

Enhanced Scalability: Polygon provides a Layer 2 scaling solution for Ethereum, allowing for the execution of a larger number of transactions in a shorter time frame.

This scalability boost enables the Ethereum network to handle more users and applications, facilitating its growth and adoption.





Reduced Costs: One of the primary concerns in the Ethereum network has been the increasing gas fees. Polygon offers a cost-efficient alternative, enabling instant and low-cost transactions.

By leveraging the MATIC network, users can enjoy reduced transaction fees and minimise their overall expenses.



Interoperability: Polygon's technology allows for seamless integration with other blockchains and networks, providing enhanced interoperability.

This interoperability opens up countless possibilities for developers and users, enabling the creation of innovative decentralised applications (dApps) and expanding the reach of the Ethereum ecosystem.

Scalability for dApps: With Polygon, developers can easily build and deploy scalable dApps on Ethereum.

The Layer 2 solution provided by Polygon ensures that dApps can handle a higher volume of users and transactions without compromising performance. This scalability enables a smoother and more efficient experience for DApp users.

Ecosystem Growth: The scalability solutions offered by MATIC and the seamless integration with Ethereum contribute to the overall growth and development of the blockchain ecosystem.



Polygon's technology attracts developers and users, fostering innovation and creating new opportunities in the rapidly evolving decentralised finance (DeFi) space.

Polygon's scaling solutions bring numerous benefits to the Ethereum network. From enhanced scalability and reduced costs to increased interoperability and ecosystem growth,

Polygon is playing a vital role in addressing Ethereum's scaling challenges and paving the way for a more efficient and sustainable blockchain ecosystem.

Exploring the Future of Scaling Ethereum with MATIC

As the demand for Ethereum continues to grow, the need for effective scaling solutions has become more pressing than ever. The integration of the MATIC network offers a promising path towards achieving scalability and enhancing the overall performance of Ethereum.

With the continuous advancements in research and development, the future of scaling Ethereum with MATIC looks bright. Here are some key aspects to consider:

Ongoing Research: Researchers and developers are actively exploring innovative approaches to further enhance the scalability of MATIC and Ethereum. Ongoing studies are focused on addressing the limitations and optimising the existing solutions. Layer 2 Improvements: The introduction of Layer 2 solutions has already demonstrated significant improvements in transaction speed and cost reduction. The future holds even greater potential for advancements in Layer 2 scaling techniques, offering a more seamless experience for Ethereum users. Adoption and Integration: As more projects realise the benefits of scaling Ethereum with MATIC, the adoption and integration of the MATIC network are expected to expand. This increased adoption will further drive the development of MATIC's infrastructure and contribute to the growth of the Ethereum ecosystem. Enhancing Interoperability: The future of scaling Ethereum with MATIC also involves enhancing interoperability with other blockchain networks. This will enable the seamless transfer of assets and data across different platforms, fostering collaboration and expanding the possibilities of decentralised applications. Community Involvement: The MATIC community plays a vital role in shaping the future of Ethereum scaling. Through active participation, feedback, and contribution, community members contribute to the continuous improvement and evolution of MATIC's scalability solutions.

Bottom Line

The integration of the MATIC network with Ethereum provides a powerful solution for scaling the Ethereum blockchain. With the growing demand and usage of Ethereum, there is an urgent need for effective scaling solutions to improve transaction speed and reduce costs. Polygon, with its innovative blockchain technology, offers a viable answer.

By leveraging the benefits of the MATIC network, Ethereum can achieve faster and more scalable transactions, enhancing user experience and opening up new possibilities for decentralised applications.

As the demand for Ethereum continues to grow, the scalability provided by Polygon and the integration of the MATIC network will play a vital role in shaping the future of the blockchain industry.

title: Crypto Price Analysis Mar-1: ETH, XRP, ADA, SOL, and BNB - CryptoPotato
content:
This week, we take a closer look at Ethereum, Ripple, Cardano, Solana, and Binance Coin.

Ethereum (ETH)

Ethereum impressed with its rally this week after booking a 16.3% price increase. In the process, buyers managed to break the resistance at $3,340 and re-test it as a key support.

While the trend remains firmly bullish, the momentum indicators appear a bit over-extended, which could make buyers exhausted if they continue at this rate. Only in February ETH increased by over 50% with little pullbacks.

Looking ahead, the most important target for ETH is found at $4,000, which will also act as a resistance.

Ripple (XRP)

Despite the volatility this week, XRP still managed to close in profit with an 11% price increase, and buyers successfully defended the support at 54 cents.

Bulls have a good shot at taking XRP higher in March after the correction that started back in November ended last month. The next target and resistance is found at 69 cents.

Looking ahead, XRP has turned bullish, and the buying volume has returned to levels not seen since 2023. These are clear signals that the buyers are in charge.

Cardano (ADA)

Cardano impressed with a 17.6% price increase this week after briefly reaching 70 cents. This performance allowed bulls to make a new local high.

The support is found at 60 cents, and the current target for this rally is 82 cents. If buyers continue at this rate in March, then the next target is only a week away.

Looking ahead, ADA bulls have returned in full force after the most recent correction ended in late February. The trend is bullish, and March looks primed for higher levels.

Solana (SOL)

Solana made a new high this year and nearly reached $138, making it the best-performing cryptocurrency on our list this week, with an impressive 31% price increase.

SOL also broke above the $126 resistance, which has since turned into a key support. Considering the buy volume, this rally seems more likely to continue.

Looking ahead, after the latest breakout, Solana’s target has moved to $163, which will also act as a key resistance.

Binance Coin (BNB)

Binance Coin reached $400 and managed to close the week with an 8% price increase. The current support is at $377, and resistance is at $437.

Even if this rally enters a pullback later, the larger trend remains bullish. If it continues, it could see BNB continue to make higher highs.

Looking ahead, this cryptocurrency is well-positioned to challenge the all-time high at $692 this year and maybe even exceed it.

title: Dormant Ethereum Whale moves ETH; Rising curiosity in Near Protocol and emerging AI Altcoin - Cyprus Mail
content:
Never say never. That’s what seemed to be the case after a dormant Ethereum (ETH) whale woke up to send tokens worth $5.15 million. There had been no activity in the wallet address for around a decade. The tokens were sent to the crypto exchange Kraken. The development comes days after Ethereum crossed $3,000.

The sudden whale activity also highlights the potential of Ethereum as the next token to power a crypto exchange-traded fund (ETF). As concerns about the legal aspects of BTC ETF continue, many analysts have suggested Ethereum ETFs might be a solution to the problem because of their versatility.

The altcoins that have been seeing rising user interest were NEAR Protocol and InQubeta (QUBE). While NEAR Protocol is a developer-friendly protocol for deploying Web 3.0 solutions, InQubeta is a fundraising service for AI projects. Its presale funding recently crossed $10.4 million.

InQubeta: Helping AI startups discover new milestones

InQubeta is an Ethereum-based cryptocurrency that doubles up as a business development ecosystem for AI startups. Its collection of services helps startups shed inhibitions and grow their business models using blockchain-based solutions.

For crypto users, InQubeta is among the best cryptocurrencies to buy now. It facilitates seamless investments in AI projects. The startups selected by InQubeta have to go through intensive screening to ensure that only the best make the cut. Startups can then raise funds by minting equity based NFTs that can be bought by investors on the InQubeta platform.

Its native cryptocurrency, the QUBE token, is a deflationary asset and can be staked. By adding InQubeta to their portfolio, people wouldn’t have to think about what cryptos to buy now for a long time.

A total token supply of 1.5 billion is split between different uses like presale, paying legal fees, compensating developers, funding marketing campaigns, and giving out staking rewards – that’s what InQubeta’s tokenomics looks like. The largest share of the token is for the presale. Only 35% of the stock of coins goes towards the expenses.

Given its presale success, the QUBE token today is a part of top analysts’ best cryptocurrency ICO lists.

Ethereum L2 Zircuit draws $128 million in deposits within 24 hours

Ethereum is a popular blockchain technology that can be customized to roll out a range of solutions like decentralized identities, blockchains, and crypto assets.

Transactions made using its native token ETH are validated with the proof-of-stake consensus protocol. Its popularity has also drawn attention to its potential to power the next crypto ETF.

Market experts suggest that the ETH token can do a better job of countering regulatory challenges for ETFs.

The cryptocurrency has been in the news after Zircuit, a Layer 2 blockchain built on Ethereum, drew over $128 million within 24 hours after it started accepting deposits. Zircuit allows crypto users to stake restaked and staked assets.

NEAR Protocol’s new wallet gains 300,000 users in 48 hours

NEAR Protocol is an emerging crypto that offers new-age tools for building powerful dApps. Developers can find multiple resources to upskill and share their ideas with professionals from the Web 3.0 industry.

The platform’s native token NEAR is used for all on-chain transactions. The Near protocol has registered a strong interest from developers due to its easy to use interface and ability to deploy dApps at the click of a button.

The platform recently released a self-custodial wallet called HERE. The wallet created a record of sorts after it clocked around 300,000 registrations within 48 hours of launch.

Its USP is that Telegram users can seamlessly set up a blockchain-powered wallet.

Conclusion

InQuebea, Ethereum, and NEAR Protocol are altcoins to watch out for this year as they haven’t let market volatility get to them till now. These tokens have posted consistent returns that have even trumped analysts’ expectations.

These crypto projects have been in the news for different reasons which has enabled them to garner more token holders. As Ethereum drew more users because of its upcoming Dencun upgrade, NEAR Protocol hit the headlines with an airdrop. InQubeta, meanwhile, grabbed the spotlight with its presale success. The collective impact of these tokens also helped with market recovery.

Market experts suggest that these tokens have a long way to go as they have high growth potential. Chances are people might see InQubeta, NEAR Protocol, and Ethereum leading the next crypto bull rally.

title: Crypto Market Prediction for $10 Trillion: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana Poised to Explode? - Coinpedia Fintech News
content:
Mustafa has been writing about Blockchain and crypto since many years. He has previous trading experience and has been working in the Fintech industry since 2017.

Story Highlights Lark Davis predicts a massive market cap of $10 trillion for the cryptocurrency space.

This projection, if realized, would mark a historic moment for the industry, attracting substantial capital.

While the prediction is optimistic, achieving a $10 trillion market cap would bring its own set of challenges.

Prominent crypto investor Lark Davis has stirred conversations with his audacious projection: a monumental $10 trillion market cap for the cryptocurrency space.

10 Trillion dollar market, highly possible this cycle, equates to…



Bitcoin $250,000

Ethereum $15,000

Solana $700 — Lark Davis (@TheCryptoLark) February 29, 2024

Let’s delve into the figures and unravel the potential implications.

Current Market Momentum

Presently, the overall market cap of the cryptocurrency space has reached $2.4 trillion, showcasing a substantial rise from the $800 billion recorded at the start of the year.

This surge follows a period of recovery from a bear market, where Bitcoin, the flagship cryptocurrency, experienced a significant decline from its all-time high of $69,000 to a low of around $16,000.

Should Davis’s foresight materialize, Bitcoin (BTC) is poised for an extraordinary surge from its current trading price of $61,500. This represents a potential increase of nearly 400%, reaching the projected price of $250,000. Achieving this valuation would necessitate a significant influx of capital into the Bitcoin market, currently valued at around $1.19 trillion.

Ethereum’s $15,000 Vision

In Davis’s forecast, Ethereum (ETH) is predicted to trade at around $15,000, signaling a substantial increase from its current value. Ethereum, with a current market cap of approximately $280 billion, would need considerable capital inflow to reach the projected price.

This surge would position Ethereum as a formidable player in the market, underlining its pivotal role in decentralized finance (DeFi) and smart contract technology.

Solana Isn’t Far Behind Either!

Davis’s projections extend to Solana (SOL), earmarked for a surge to $700. With Solana’s current market cap standing at approximately $23 billion, achieving the predicted price would involve heightened investor interest and significant capital injection. This potential surge positions Solana as a significant player in the blockchain ecosystem, contributing to the ongoing narrative of scalable and high-performance blockchain platforms.

Implications of a $10 Trillion Market Cap

Beyond the exciting projections lies the potential realization of a historic milestone—a $10 trillion market cap for the cryptocurrency space. This achievement would not only mark a significant moment in the industry’s history but also introduce new opportunities and challenges for market participants.

title: Ethereum Deflationary Meme Coin, $PEPE, Surges Over 145% In 7 Days - NullTX
content:
The Ethereum deflationary memecoin, $PEPE, has experienced a remarkable surge of over 145% in its price over the past seven days, capturing the attention of investors and enthusiasts alike.

In a recent development, a smart whale identified as 0x37d has made significant moves in the $PEPE market. The whale recently deposited a staggering 1.97 trillion $PEPE tokens, valued at $6.06 million, to Binance just a few hours ago.

This strategic move potentially positions the whale to capitalize on substantial gains, with an estimated profit of $3.47 million, representing a remarkable 135% increase if the tokens are indeed sold at current prices.

After $PEPE reached new ATH, smart whale 0x37d deposited all 1.97T $PEPE ($6.06M) to #Binance ~7hrs ago, making $3.47M (+135%) if truly selling. Moreover, the whale withdrew 75.91B $SHIB ($893K) from #Binance for the first time ~1hr ago. The cumulative deposits amounted to 1.97 trillion $PEPE tokens over the past few hours, with an average acquisition price of $0.000003073, translating to a substantial investment of $6.06 million.

Despite the recent surge in $PEPE price, reaching a new all-time high of $0.000003524 nine hours ago, the market experienced a slight downturn of 3.38% in the past hour.

This decline may be attributed to the impact of the whale’s selling activity, reflecting the significant influence of large investors on market dynamics.

As $PEPE continues to capture attention within the crypto community, the actions of whales and traders play a pivotal role in shaping its market trajectory, driving speculation and interest among investors.

title: 6 Best Crypto Wallets For Beginners in 2024 - CoinCodex
content:
Choosing the right cryptocurrency wallet can be one of the most intimidating aspects of getting started with crypto. We’ll get you started off on the right foot by providing a list of the best crypto wallets for beginners.

The best crypto wallets for beginners

We’ve made sure to include a variety of wallets to provide options for every type of crypto investor, regardless of whether you’re a long-term holder or frequent user of crypto.

Ledger Nano S Plus - Best hardware crypto wallet for beginners

- Best hardware crypto wallet for beginners Trust Wallet - Best software crypto wallet for beginners

- Best software crypto wallet for beginners Coinbase Wallet - Best crypto wallet for Coinbase users

- Best crypto wallet for Coinbase users MetaMask - Best Ethereum wallet overall

- Best Ethereum wallet overall Electrum - Best Bitcoin wallet for desktop

- Best Bitcoin wallet for desktop Phantom - Best Solana wallet for beginners

1. Ledger Nano S Plus - Best hardware crypto wallet for beginners

If you’re approaching cryptocurrency with a long-term buy and hold strategy, you should strongly consider getting a hardware cryptocurrency wallet. A hardware cryptocurrency wallet is a secure device that stores the private keys necessary to access your cryptocurrency without exposing them to devices that could potentially be compromised (computers and phones that are connected to the internet).

The Ledger Nano S Plus is a hardware wallet that offers very strong security at a reasonable price of $79. This wallet is an upgraded version of the Ledger Nano S, which had established itself as the go-to hardware wallet for crypto investors worldwide.

This hardware wallet can be used to store more than 5,500 different cryptocurrencies. It implements advanced, independently audited security systems and works seamlessly with the Ledger Live software for easy portfolio and transaction management.

Get a Ledger Nano S Plus

2. Trust Wallet - Best software crypto wallet for beginners

One of the main reasons why we believe Trust Wallet is the best software crypto wallet for beginners is that it supports a diverse range of cryptocurrencies. This allows users to manage their cryptocurrency with one app instead of having to hop to a different app for each coin they hold.

The wallet is compatible with Bitcoin, Ethereum (including blockchains compatible with Ethereum's Virtual Machine), XRP, and various other well-known cryptocurrencies.

Trust Wallet is user-friendly, featuring an interface that accommodates both novice and experienced crypto investors. It enables users to track the value of their crypto portfolio in their preferred currency, review their on-chain transaction history, and efficiently manage a variety of cryptocurrencies.

In addition, Trust Wallet includes a decentralized application (DApp) browser, which allows interaction with DApps through the wallet. Trust Wallet also has features for buying and selling cryptocurrencies, swapping tokens, and staking capabilities.

Get Trust Wallet

3. Coinbase Wallet - Best crypto wallet for Coinbase users

Coinbase Wallet is a cryptocurrency wallet developed by the Coinbase cryptocurrency exchange. Coinbase Wallet is non-custodial, which means that the responsibility of managing private keys is completely up to the user.

This wallet supports multiple blockchains, including Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, XRP, Stellar, Litecoin and Dogecoin. In addition, Coinbase Wallet supports various Ethereum-based layer 2 networks and can also be used to store ERC-20 tokens.

Beyond the basic features of holding and transacting cryptocurrency, Coinbase Wallet also offers some advanced features, such as the ability to make token swaps through decentralized exchanges directly from the wallet’s interface.

In addition to cryptocurrencies, Coinbase Wallet can also be used to manage and transact with NFTs.

Coinbase Wallet is a great choice if your centralized exchange of choice is Coinbase. This is because the wallet can be linked with a Coinbase account for streamlined crypto transfers.

Get Coinbase Wallet

4. MetaMask - Best Ethereum wallet overall

MetaMask is a wallet designed to work with Ethereum and other blockchains that are with the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM). It's available both as a web browser extension and a mobile application. MetaMask enjoys widespread adoption within the Ethereum ecosystem, with nearly all Ethereum-based decentralized applications (DApps) supporting it.

MetaMask can of course be used to hold and transact with ETH and Ethereum-based tokens, but the wallet also offers features for buying, selling, and swapping crypto tokens directly on the blockchain. MetaMask also has a portfolio tracker which you can use to easily monitor the performance of your crypto holdings.

MetaMask is a great choice for beginners, as well as advanced users who often interact with DeFi protocols or NFT marketplaces. It can function as a hot wallet for everyday use, but if you want to use it to manage larger amounts of crypto, we recommend you pair it with a hardware wallet like the Ledger Nano Plus for enhanced security. You can learn more about this topic in our article comparing hot wallets vs. cold wallets.

Get MetaMask

5. Electrum - Best Bitcoin wallet for desktop

If you are a Bitcoin holder and want a wallet for your desktop or Android device, Electrum is a great choice. This non-custodial wallet is easy to use for basic transactions, but also offers advanced features that will come in handy as you level up your knowledge of Bitcoin. For example, Electrum can be used as a multisig wallet, and it also supports third-party plugins.

You can use Electrum as a hot wallet for everyday Bitcoin transactions, but the wallet has also integrated support for hardware wallets from manufacturers such as Ledger and Trezor if you want to use it to manage more substantial transactions.

A great thing about the Electrum wallet is that it connects to a decentralized server network, which means you’re not very likely to experience any issues with downtime. While it is a very solid wallet, Electrum is limited to Bitcoin, so you should look for alternatives if you also want to store other cryptocurrencies.

Get Electrum Wallet

6. Phantom - Best Solana wallet for beginners

Phantom is a wallet that has become the go-to option for many Solana users. Since its launch, however, the Phantom team has expanded the scope of their wallet to also include support for the Bitcoin, Ethereum and Polygon blockchains.

Phantom provides a slick user interface, strong support for NFTs, as well as built-in token swapping and staking features. The Phantom wallet is non-custodial and can be used in tandem with hardware wallets, which also makes it suitable for long-term crypto storage.

The Phantom wallet has a feature that detects when the user is about to approve a transaction that’s identified as potentially malicious. For example, the user might be connecting to a phishing website that’s designed to trick users into approving a transaction that drains their wallet.

Phantom is available either as a mobile app on iOS and Android, or as a browser extension in Chrome, Firefox and other popular browsers.

Get Phantom Wallet

The bottom line

Even though the wallets we have featured in this article are suitable for beginners, they are all high-quality pieces of software that will serve you well even as you become a more advanced cryptocurrency user. When picking among these wallets, consider which cryptocurrencies you want to store and whether you want to use your wallet as a mobile app, desktop program or browser extension.

All of the wallets we have featured in this article are non-custodial, which means that the user has the sole responsibility of securing their private keys. This is great since you don’t have to trust any third parties to keep your crypto safe, but it also means you have to ensure to back up your recovery phrases and never share your private keys with anyone.

If you’re trying to learn more about everything you need to keep in mind when starting your crypto journey, make sure to take a look at our ultimate guide to investing in crypto.
